headline: China launches probes targeting US semiconductors ahead of Madrid trade talks
summary: China launched two probes targeting the U.S. semiconductor sector Saturday ahead of talks between the two nations in Spain this week on trade, national security and the ownership of social media platform TikTok.  China’s Ministry of Commerce announced an anti-dumping investigation into certain analog IC chips imported from the U.S. The investigation will target some commodity interface IC chips and gate driver IC chips, which are commonly made by U.S. companies such as Texas Instruments and ON Semiconductor.  The ministry separately announced an anti-discrimination probe into U.S. measures against China’s chip sector.
